title: Trouble with payments
content:
I have so much trouble with payment sites. Showing the wrong amount, or just plain doesn't work, then I go over to Chrome, and it's fine. Why is this?

I have Bitwarden Password Manager, Duck Duck Go Privacy Essentials, Facebook Container, and Tab Session Manager extensions.

I keep getting "something went wrong" on this site: https://signup.grasshopper.com/billing even though it does not point to a specific field, and I have checked all the fields.

I have had similar things happen several times recently, sorry, I don't remember the details. I know I tried to purchase something from loft.com, and there should have been a discount, and it was not showing up, but if I went to Chrome, it worked fine.

Additional info: FF 142.0 (64-bit) Windows 10.0.26120 Build 26120 (Windows 11) Hardware accelerate on. layout.frame_rate -1 intel i9 iGPU, nVidia 4060 laptop dGPU

title: How do I ban permissions for all sites?
content:
What happened to Firefox's permission's page? There's so few options now. I'm being harassed by websites to give them permission that should be blocked across the entire browser. I'm autistic and sensitive to popups/interruptions/distractions. So most permissions I simply had off for everything, because I don't want to be asked anything. I don't want to confirm anything. I don't want any popup of any type. So I turned everything off and it was good. (except blocking cookies of course)

But now sites are asking me again and there's no way to blanket turn off everything. I see I can press "Ctrl+i" to bring up specific permissions for that site, but that's not good enough. I specifically need permissions blocked for sites I've never visited. Needing to visit the site first completely defeats the purpose.

The permissions listed in the settings isn't all of them. How do I turn off ALL permissions for ALL sites. I can turn on specific permissions when I want them. Essentially, how do I recreate functionality that used to exist but was removed from us for whatever reason.

Also, it's a huge security hole! I'm a senior full stack developer. Asking permissions for a user is a great way to fingerprint them. If I accidentally hit "yes" to a few key permissions, I can be fingerprinted. Another reason I should be able to blanket ban these permissions. I just want my browser to be a browser. These permissions do nothing for me but make the experience worse.

title: Unknown Microsoft Login Appearing in Saved Passwords
content:
Hi,

I recently noticed an unknown Outlook/Microsoft account (oliveconscious13@outlook.com) saved in my Firefox logins. The email and password appear to be randomly generated, and the account‚Äôs preferred language is set to Russian. I have never seen or used this account before.

Here are the key details:

My Firefox account was created on June 8, 2025.

The unknown Microsoft account was created on July 8, 2025.

I only have two devices connected to my Firefox account: my Mac (where the account first appeared) and my Windows PC.

The account is also showing up in Chrome‚Äôs saved passwords, which I never intentionally synced with Firefox.

This is a brand-new Mac purchased directly from Apple, so I know it wasn‚Äôt a used device.

I‚Äôm trying to figure out:

How this account was added to my saved logins.

Whether this was synced from another device.

If there‚Äôs any security concern or if my account may be compromised.

Could you check my sync history or logs to see which device added this login, and advise on how to make sure my saved logins are secure?

title: My Experience with the Best Numerology Course Online
content:
When I first decided to learn numerology, I wasn‚Äôt sure which path to take. There are so many courses available that it can be hard to know which one is truly worth your time and effort. After researching and going through multiple reviews, I finally enrolled in what I now call the Best numerology course online, and the experience was incredible.

The course began with a strong foundation, explaining the core principles of numerology in a way that even a beginner could easily follow. Gradually, it introduced advanced concepts, which made my learning journey smooth and structured. The lessons were detailed yet easy to understand, supported by examples, charts, and practical exercises that helped me apply the knowledge immediately.

One of the things I loved most was the guidance provided by the instructors. Even though it was an online program, I never felt alone in my learning. My questions were always answered promptly, and the interactive community allowed me to connect with fellow learners, share experiences, and practice readings together. What truly set this course apart was its focus on real-life application. I didn‚Äôt just learn theories; I learned how to use numerology for personal growth, decision-making, and helping others. By the end, I felt confident enough to perform accurate readings and even offer consultations.

If you are looking for the best numerology course online, I highly recommend considering the one offered by Bhartiya Institute of Vedic Science. It is well-structured, beginner-friendly, and comprehensive enough for those who want to go deeper into the subject.

Overall, this course has been a life-changing experience for me ‚Äî one that has not only given me a new skill but also opened my mind to a fascinating world of numbers and their hidden meanings.

title: Firefox kills audio driver, causing computer to become silent
content:
Note:Translation of questions from DEEPL Laptop system version: Windows 10, 21H2, 19044.6093. Firefox version: 141.0.3 (64-bit) The laptop has 16GB of RAM, an AMD 4600H processor, and a GTX 1650 graphics card.

When opening web pages in Firefox (this time it crashed after opening three regular pages), there is a chance it will freeze with a white screen and display a ‚Äúnot responding‚Äù pop-up window, while also causing the system audio driver to malfunction. Clicking the speaker icon in the bottom-right corner takes a long time to display the volume slider, but the slider cannot be moved, or adjusting the volume does not produce any sound. Forcing Firefox to close and reopening it also causes it to freeze. The only way to avoid the white screen and unresponsive state is for Firefox to automatically detect the crash and prompt whether to open a new page. The audio driver issue requires restarting the computer to resolve. So what is the underlying issue? How can I report this bug to the official team for analysis and resolution? If it's difficult to resolve, I'll consider switching to the ESR version of Firefox.

(Annoying past experience: This situation has occurred several times before when using Firefox. At that time, I had 2-3 web pages with videos open, mainly video websites, and the speaker icon was directly crossed out with an X, causing the computer desktop to crash as well. The computer became extremely laggy, and the Task Manager and security options were difficult to open. After restarting the computer, Firefox automatically reopened the previously unclosed page, causing the desktop to crash immediately upon startup, entering a loop. It seemed that even Windows Safe Mode didn't work, and a forced upgrade to a major Windows version was required to resolve the issue, followed by reinstalling a bunch of software.)

title: Using canvas/context to scale an image that displays ok before removes the image data, ok in Chome/Safari.
content:
The app sizes two adjacent images to the same height. Maybe there's a better approach?

This works, in that I see the original image displayed at the wrong size: 

   //img.src = imgsrc.src;

This sizes the image but without the data (black square for toDataURL w/ image/jpeg) in FF, but not Chrome and Safari: 

   var canvas = document.createElement( 'canvas' );    canvas.width = width;    canvas.height = avail_height;    var context = canvas.getContext( '2d' ); 
   // Tried/failed: Fill white background for JPEG export    //context.fillStyle = '#fff';    //context.fillRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height); 
   context.drawImage( imgsrc, 0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);    context.lineWidth = 150; // ?? 
   img.src = canvas.toDataURL('image/jpeg', 0.92);    img.onmousedown = disableDragging; // for FF    img.style.opacity = "1.0"

The page is the view.html one gets to via Enter on phobrain.com.

title: cant disable translation
content:
i went to about:config -> browser.translations.enable and also browser.translations.automaticallyPopup , making sure it reads "false", and also went to Firefox Menu > Settings > General > Language and Appearance and under Languages the only language other than spanish (the language i want the browser to be) is english (maybe that way it recognizes it as an "allowed" language or something and doesnt translate from it)

...but it still translates pages from english (sometimes even translating the search result and directing me to a translate-version of the page instead of to the the page itself).

how can i make it not translate things from english anymore? (if the only solution is to stop translating altogether from any language, i'll gladly take it as long as it stops translating from english)
creator: mrblackfiredragon

title: Flickering in upper right screen
content:
I found a problem with McAfee Webadvisor 13 Aug 2025 release. It causes flickering in the upper right part of the screen. Disabling it in Extensions fixes the problem. Removing it and reinstalling causes the problem to reoccur. This is new, had no problems yesterday but today all four of my family's computers have this problem. I will report the problem to McAfee and give an update if I get a response.

Tony D.
